candidates.title: Bump heim
candidates.body: This bumps the heim dependency to fix an issue with sysinfo

candidates.title: Release 0.3.0
candidates.body: Get ready to roll out the 0.3.0 release

candidates.title: Add urlencode/urldecode
candidates.body: Adds the ability to urlencode tables and urldecode strings into tables.

candidates.title: Fix internal $it paths
candidates.body:
* Fixes internal commands so that they fire either:
  * Once, if it's the producer/head of the pipeline
  * Once for each value in the pipeline

Previously, this behavior was controlled by whether $it was detected or not

candidates.title: Sublime style history search
candidates.body:
Searching the history is one of my most often used shell commands. In addition to the classic Bash Ctrl-R search, I've done a little proof of concept for an interactive search with Sublime-style matching.

In the demo you see me typing `cabu` matching `cargo build`:

![nusearch](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19007/64927648-c43cbc80-d80d-11e9-9fba-ff37731af28e.gif)

If this fits the nushell philosophy, I would be happy to submit a PR with a proper integration.

candidates.title: Improve default features and don't precompute ls
candidates.body:
Two unrelated fixes:

* We this nu will no longer precompute the entries for `ls`. This should help cut down on memory usage for large lists. I could probably go a bit further and turn this into a generator (something to explore later)
* Change the default feature set so by default when you build you have something similar to the 0.2.0 release.  You can pass `--no-default-features` or `--all-features` depending on your needs.

candidates.title: Switch to rustline git instead of crates.io
candidates.body: There have been a few fixes in rustyline we want to help test, so let's switch to their latest master ahead of the next release.

candidates.title: Add basic 'did you mean' support
candidates.body:
This adds the ability to do `did you mean?` style errors. Currently, I've only hooked it into the `get` command.

Example:

![Screenshot from 2019-09-13 15-31-01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/547158/64836319-838e4900-d63d-11e9-8d1f-9088cd07b5dc.png)

candidates.title: Revert "Migrate most uses of the Span concept to Tag"
candidates.body: Revert the span->tag change. With the CI settings we should be able to see these happen more real time.

candidates.title: Migrate most uses of the Span concept to Tag
candidates.body:
Also migrate mv, rm and commands like that to taking a
SyntaxType::Pattern instead of a SyntaxType::Path for their first
argument.

candidates.title: Make some plugins optional, move ps to plugin
candidates.body:
This moves more of the optional components to actual optional parts of the build. As they both aren't tested and require special dependencies, these can add more time to the build without necessarily being something you want out of the box.

To make it easy to add everything, I also have created an `all` dependency that does everything.

candidates.title: Update rust-argon2 in Cargo.lock
candidates.body:
Rids us of crossbeam v0.5 and lots of other crates.
For most users this only effects Cargo.lock though,
as rust-argon2 is only compiled when targeting
redox.

chosen_pr.title: Bump heim
chosen_pr.body: This bumps the heim dependency to fix an issue with sysinfo
